It was in a food court so don't expect much from the ambiance. However this was a great place for a quick meal or lunch.

The service is awesome. One of the most friendly and personal peoples.  Plenty of tables and urban space is chill. I like the vibes. Great place!
Amazing broth and perfectly scorched pork belly, great welcoming energy from Lawrence. Very hospitable! Highly recommended to try and try again some more!

Very bland ramen. I've had way better at other restaurants.  I purchased the spicy signature nin niku ramen.
This spot is amazing! I ordered a chicken teriyaki bento and the chicken was cooked just right and very juicy. Karen and Fred were also very friendly and professional. Will definitely come back soon!

Was walking around Fidi and found this fire spot in the new Urbanspace. Had the signature black garlic ramen with egg and kaki fry. The ramen was cooked perfectly and the broth hit the spot. Definitely worth stopping by if you are in the area!!

This is one of my favorite ramen restaurants in NYC. The flavor is really similar to what I had when I was in Tokyo. The black garlic ramen is to kill for. The soup base is smooth and tasty. I highly recommend it.

I ordered the signature chasu bento box. I followed an recommendation to add the potatoes croquettes. If you're not feeling ramen, this is worth the try. Highly...recommended!
The ramen is really good, I got their specialty. But I really have to give special attention to their karaage, it was hot and juicy!

The ramen came out cold without any heat coming from the bowl.  The broth cooled the noodles destroying the entire ramen experience. The broth was also bland despite being the signature black garlic tonkotsu. I ordered the combo, which comes with Gyoza on the side--also cold:(  When the vendor asked how the ramen is, I replied that it was cold. It appeared that the vendor proceeded to turn up the heat on the broth, but offered no apology or consolation. Also the egg is an add-on ingredient. In my opinion, the egg should be standard. The chashu had good flavor. A torch was used to char it before serving, but again it was cooled by the broth. At $20 a bowl, the flavor and execution should have been on point.
The black garlic ramen was spectacular. Definitely recommend, along with the lemonade. Will be back again soon.

Came here for lunch recently, glad I did. The Signature Black Garlic Spicy Ramen is amazing! The broth, roasted pork, noodle, and egg is freaking yummy! Super nice staff working there as well. Will be back for sure!

I had the black Garlic Ramen with pork and it was delicious. Couldn't have been more happy. Honestly haven't had ramen like that in awhile. Highly recommend getting a soft boiled egg added as well. Definitely the best ramen I've had since traveling to Japan. The Shitake mushrooms really brought out the flavors of the broth. The pork was delicious too and absolutely melted in your mouth. 10/10 would go back and try again! Really want to try out their other ramen meals as well! I'm a very happy customer! Can't recommend enough!

Tried the Black Garlic ramen. Fantastic melt in your mouth Charsiu. Wasn't overly salty like most ramen shops. Drank the broth entirely. Great chat with the chef owner while pulling up a stool to eat there. Their gyoza dumplings were also delicious, filled with pork and chives Definitely will come back again.
No comment
Amazing authentic ramen and other Japanese noodle dishes with just the right amount of clever twists on classic recipes, all with masterful execution!

Wow! The ramen and dumplings were amazing. I had the famous Black Garlic ramen with spice. Noodles were cooked perfect, the broth wasn't oily. It tasted heavenly. Can't forget the gyoza dumplings. They were so flavorful. The chef was so friendly and was able to answer all my questions. I will definitely be back! I have to try everything on the menu :)

Best tsukumen ramen I've ever had. Noodles are thick and chewy. Broth is complex and garlicky. The chashu is the best I've ever had. This ramen is Japanese approved! Get the black garlic nin'niku ramen also! Spicy makes it even better. Also recommend the chashu bento. TRY THEIR CHASHU NO JOKE ITS INSANE!!

Yikes, hard pass. Asked for the signature black garlic ramen and with spicy, which is $1 extra. The guy must've not heard me because he asked me if I'd like it spicy. I said yes. We came well before the lunch hour so it was just me and one other customer. Sorry for the incoming karen moment but the ramen I received was not spicy. You see, this wouldn't be nutty to me if 1) they didn't charge me for it and 2) if there was a better excuse for their mistake like a rush hour. Also, it's quite  hard to justify paying *more than $20* for ramen where the broth was very mild tasting, much less not what you asked for, noodles that weren't anything special, much less not chewy, and all with only two pieces of unremarkable chashu. Also interesting to note mine looked nothing like the image of the signature ramen posted here. What I received only had mushrooms. There was no seaweed, no bamboo shoots, no scallions, no bean sprouts. The egg is an additional charge, so that made sense, but I wonder if receiving each of the above ingredients  would be an additional $1 each (which is especially nutty considering the above are pretty basic ramen staples and the base cost already puts you at $20) or if this placed has experienced completely different management since then. I know this is FiDi and we're all hurting from inflation, but other restaurants here have still managed to provide quality service and food without leaving you feel like you've been robbed. Anyways, this was disappointing to say the least.

No wine was included on their happy hour menu which I was disappointed about. I loved the red wine I ordered (sadly I don't remember the name). Carlos was the bartender and he was great! Really accommodating and speedy with his service. I ordered the spinach artichoke dip which was delicious; came out piping hot with half a baguette. Overall, I'd definitely stop back!
Great service! The plates came really quickly and were both delicious. Also the basil drink smells and tastes fantastic! Just though the music were too loud. Besides that, great!

Everything here was pretty good. I really liked the appetizer. Entrees were okay. Would come back here to try their brunch menu. We had their dinner menu.
We were in a quest for a real croque monsieur and this did not disappoint. Nice food, lovely service and a cool neighborhood vibe. Can't wait to go back!
Great local space, intimate and laid back. The meal was delicious and the staff were attentive. Great for a cozy date night or casual dinner with friends.
Got the steak frites and it wasn't very good. Steak was tough and cold.  The ambiance is nice and the service is good too.

A decent neighborhood bistro with a good selection of wine if you're into that sort of thing. The meal was decent but the duck was a bit tough. If you're craving french food around chinatown, it's not a bad choice. They also have daily specials and live music on certain days.
Great brunch spot with friendly staff and an intimate setting. Can't speak for the cocktails since I didn't have any, but everything else was great.

Like different cheese on the croissant sandwich. Food was tasty though. Our waitress outfit was pretty skimpy, super short skort-I was surprised. Service was alright. Good but not sure id come back. excellent poached eggs & best coffee I've had in a while. This is a hole in the wall gem - limited but solid and very French menu
Great little comfy French bistro on the corner of Henry and Jefferson streets. Warm welcoming service with great drinks and food. I will be back.

All dishes were amazing, outdoor seating is also cute. I got a pear cocktail which was also extremely delicious. The kale salad was really unique, with greek yogurt and orange and anchovies. There's not really vegetarian entrees but it's a special that changes. They made me a risotto with burrata and tomatoes, red onions, and pesto drizzle. It was amazing and a huge portion, so I took the leftovers home put it into an omelette the next morning! Very cute place. Appreciated their duck dish is called "coin coin" which means "quack quack" in French.
Solid place in LES for brunch. Had no trouble finding a table and food was great. Recommend to bring cash.

Nice and cozy French restaurant. Yummy oyster special on Wednesdays ($1.50 each) kale salad was delicious. The steak frites and blue cheese burger (could use more blue cheese) were also quite yummy! Service was great by the gentleman (Colin?)  who also was the host. Drinks were also good especially the Spicy Carrot margarita. I have to come back when there is live music! Solid neighborhood spot! I like that they also give a little salad with the mains, very European and Balanced.

Mediocre food and service. It always has seats thou so that's convenient for the neighborhood
Good place for brunch, kid friendly. Less crowded sidewalk cafe experience than you get a couple to blocks north. Cash preferred with a surcharge on credit cards.

Went for dinner with friends recently. Food, drinks were amazing. Pricing was also very reasonable. Only thing is service is a little slow but they only had 2 servers for the entire restaurant so understandable. Would recommend the mussels with a side of fries!
We sat in the covered patio on the sidewalk and appreciated the heaters! The food was incredible and the service top notch. Thank you!

Lovely French eatery with great staff. I stopped by for a cocktail on my way to the Van Gogh Experience exhibit. I decided to return for dinner after the expo. The energy in this place is great for dates and intimate friend outings. The lighting is great. I first sat at the bar for drinks. I later sat at a table for dinner. I had the steak frites and my partner had the mussels. I will definitely return - they have daily specials! S/O to Miranda the bartender!
Great atmosphere, music, food. Would definitely return and have referred friends who say the same.

I've tried the oysters, the steak frites, and the mussels. All delicious! Their espresso martini is fabulous as well! Highly recommend.

Delicious. Great food, quick service, nice staff. Would go again. The foie gras was magic

This place was amazing. Good service, nice outdoor dining, live music and great food. Definitely coming back.

Great night at Les enchants de boheme! Will definitely swing by more. They have live music on Thursday and Saturday nights and we just so happened to have a birthday so it made it 100 times better. The food was delicious. I separately came here for brunch in the past and that was yummy as well. Perfect place to go to for a date or for a small group. Shots were passed on the house. There is a cake cutting fee for those that are aap planning to celebrate birthdays here ($7 per person). They additionally accept card for those that are wondering.

Had a lovely time here. Our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive. Two Bridges cocktail was amazing, 10/10. Ordered the soup of the day which was a squash soup with cream, we gave it a 3/5. It was okay, nothing exciting about the soup.. a bit too watery and lacking in seasoning. For entrees we ordered the duck, which is easily a 10/10. It was cooked to perfection and had amazing flavor. The second entree we ordered was the beef which we gave a 9/10, the only complaint about the beef was that we found it extremely salty, however other than that it was quite delicious. Definitely recommend trying this place out for date night.

Great food and amazing atmosphere. It's so hard to find a quiet brunch spot in the city. Loved it!
Amazing food, perfect music, lovely service, warm and welcoming atmosphere. The roast is perfectly cooked and accompanied by delicious sides. Lovely spot for an intimate date.

Incredible experience. The lighting, mood, vibe, the music, the food, and team (all around, hands down  team) are all so good. We were welcomed from the start. I had the duck, which was perfectly marbled, and not overwhelming fatty...the first duck I ever loved tbh. Their bartenders mix up amazing gin, whiskey, and mezcal cocktails... Miranda is so welcoming and attentive. 7 out of 5 folks. A must.

Good vibe, great food with very pleasant staff, great music. Stopped in after an event nearby & had a lovely late brunch. Making reservations ahead is a good idea though the wait without one will be worth it, I promise.  The bacon made me swoon & finding a perfect Eggs Benedict made me so very happy. My husband devoured his Croque Monsieur. Go!

column6: The food was pretty good. The mussels were a bit gritty. We asked for medium-rare steak but it was closer to medium/medium-well. We were seated outdoors and it wasn't too busy, but I didn't feel like the waitresses really checked in with us, and never asked how our food was. Outdoor seating had an overall casual and maybe a little dingy feel, the inside looked much nicer though. They have a 3% fee if you use a credit card.

I have been here a few times and each time the experience is personable, warm, friendly and absolutely delicious. Some of my favorites are steak frites, and their signature salad with chicken. Poached eggs always cooked to perfection, and the drinks are always on point... try the espresso martini. All of the staff is warm, attentive, and really adds to the overall experience. The music, ambience, and lighting are always on point. I always return here for both business and leisure. Bon appetit!

Nice place, pleasant people.  Sadly, slow service, forgot portions of order, didn't disclose in advance credit card premium, no substitutions.    More frustrating than it should've been.

This was a wonderful experience for my friend's birthday brunch. The staff was accommodating: we were running late and had to move the reservation back 30 mins and there were 11 of us. Not a problem! The interior is very pleasant - everyone commented on the mural on the back wall. Most of the party had some form of Eggs Benedict (with salmon, ham, etc.) I had the Croque Madame, which was absolutely delicious! Two friends ordered mimosas and they were quite strong! Prices were very reasonable for the good amount of food and drinks we ordered. Only gripe is the cash-only policy but their great service and food make up for it. Plus there's an ATM inside!

I think this place is overrated. We came here on a weekday night after seeing the immersive Van Gogh exhibit at Pier 36. We were looking for restaurants nearby, and this restaurant showed up on Yelp, so we decided to give it a try. We got outdoor seating and ordered several drinks (spicy margarita and red wine), two appetizers (tartine and soup; we wanted to order oysters but they were not available), an entree (duck), and a dessert (chocolate mousse). I like the cocktail, but the food was just ok. The duck was not tender, and the potatoes weren't cooked well. Even the sauce wasn't tasty. The service was very slow. I'm not sure if they are understaffed. We waited at least twenty minutes to just get the drinks, and another twenty minutes for appetizers. The whole meal took almost two hours. The server never came to check whether everything was ok. She took away the water bottle on our table but didn't come back with a refilled bottle until we asked her. The only time for the quick service was when we asked for check, and the bill came immediately. They do charge a 3% fee if you are paying with credit card. You can also pay cash. They have an ATM inside the restaurant.
Hands down favorite place to eat great food with the coolest people and the best vibe. So happy they're open again. The LES Enfants experience is consistently fantastic. LOVE. THIS. PLACE. GO!!!!
The outside seating is real cute. The artichoke dip was amazing. The best I ever had! The staff wasn't friendly. Kind of rude, nobody smiled. The menu is difficult, wish they had some pictures.

Stopped by for an outdoors December brunch. The outdoor dining area was pleasant and fairly comfortable although issues regarding the function of outdoor heaters precluded their use on the date we visited. The food was very good, as has been the case on previous visits. I had a crepe Norvege, a buckwheat crepe filled with salmon and goat cheese and topped with a nice small salad. GF had Eggs Florentine poached eggs with Tuscan kale. Everything was tasty and nicely presented and the service was also good. If they get the outdoor heaters to function, looking forward to brunch outdoors in January or February .

We were there for a birthday dinner. The place is magical. The food, the live music, the warm staff. It's become one of our favorite places in town. Check it out.

Last night we had another wonderful night at Les Enfants. The food is always delicious, it has a sophisticated wine selection, the atmosphere has a wonderfully bohemian vibe, the service staff is great. Been coming here for the past few years regularly, with large groups for special events and for a romantic dinner with my man. I can't recommend it enough! (i love the kale salad and the chicken entry, so good)
Great spot with real French crepes and a nice brunch / breakfast menu. Plus the staff is friendly !

First of all, BEST French bread in NYC, hands down. Besides that, this place is a hidden gem. The food is great--the pâté is a MUST have and the braised beef is identical to what my grandmother used to make. Our waitress Aida was so attentive and gave us complementary champagne at the end of our meal, plus extra bread to take home (we were ecstatic). The bartender (whose name has slipped my mind) made fabulous martinis that we had to personally complement him on. My boyfriend got an espresso martini and I got one of their signatures, the filthy husband (basically just a super dirty vodka martini). Both were amazing. If you're looking for great food without the price tag and the typical dimes square crowds...do not miss this place! I cannot say better things.

We went here to celebrate a birthday, sat inside and it was so good! The service was great, the food was FAST and delicious, and the brunch cocktails were yummy! We all had eggs benedict or eggs florentine, and the eggs were cooked perfectly, and everything was fresh and delicious! We will definitely be back

I have to admit, Les Enfants de Boheme was really exceptional. Reasonable rates for this area. Excellent food, Croque Madame was incredible without a doubt. This Croque Madame was prepared just perfectly. Wonderful central location, excellent service. Les Enfants de Boheme - It is a unique and wonderful experience.

We were seated near the kitchen and for some reason the lights around us was very dim, I wish the lights were a little better so I wouldn't have to struggle to look at the menu. My boyfriend and I ordered the Les egg Norwegian and Les egg Florentine. It came quick. I love that my eggs were runny. Highly recommend this spot for brunch

Came on a Saturday during lunch time. I had the Croque Madame which was excellent and my friend had the Eggs Benedict, which she described as the best eggs benedict she's had in a while. We also had the regular crepe to share which was a bit disappointing. Will definitely be coming back to try other dishes.

If you know how special the friendly neighborhood bistro is to a Parisian, we'll, that's what Les Enfants is for us. Good food, good company, good times.
The food, drinks, staff, ambience, everything is amazing. Such a lovely and authentic French hidden gem in the LES. 11/10 can't recommend it more

Came here before seeing the Van Gogh exhibit with my mom and boyfriend and it was SUPERB! At first we were a little hesitant because it isn't the most beautiful location, but the food was delicious! The spinach and artichoke dip is a must, their mussels in white was delicious and so was the slow cooked beef. Highly recommend!

Best servers!! Best food !! Best place! Umm HELLO!!! Les Enfants is seriously my sanctuary. Been coming here for years and have only had 10/10 experiences. Besides the magnificent cocktails and mussels, I really come here for the lovely waitresses that always make my time here memorable. Merci queens!! Xx

column6: I recently moved to the neighborhood and finally got a chance to check out Les Enfants de Bohème. This place is awesome. The staff are all super friendly and helpful. Miranda suggested that I try the peccarino risotto special they had, after I told them I was a vegetarian looking for suggestions. All I can say is Damn! it was so good. They also helped me pick out a beer. They have a great German pilsner. They had lovley live music and an open and inviting atmosphere.  Everyone on the staff was friendly, helpful and made sure I had everything I needed.  They were pretty busy and they all still took the time to go above and beyond.

A great find!  My friend and I had a pre-Van Gogh dinner here and it was terrific. Food, service and atmosphere were all top-notch. So much so that we chose to go back after the exhibit for an at-the-bar drink only to find that it's also a bit of a neighbourhood hangout - very cool and definitely on the "must go back to" list!

I was in the area for an art gallery opening and happened to stop here for dinner after since it was nearby. Be aware this place is CASH ONLY but they do have an ATM in the back. We got the cucumber salad to share and it was pretty good, but the mussels I had for my entree could have been much better. They were tiny and over cooked with broken shells throughout. Not sure how this place has 4.5 stars. Maybe brunch is better?

intimate french restaurant that's good for small parties or for a date night. food was very delicious. the slow braised beef was tender and the carrots were fresh. the mussels were a large portion but weren't as fresh as i would like them. the duck was extremely good, highly recommend that. overall, good food, good ambience, would come again.

Had a really nice brunch here before seeing the Van Gogh exhibit.  It is a small, casual neighborhood place that definitely is worth a visit if you are nearby.

Coffee was good (very important).  I kept it basic with two eggs over easy and side of bacon.  The bacon side was amazing in itself.  First, normally a side costs a lot and you get little.  This place got it backwards.  Second and more importantly, it was very tasty.  I couldn't finish it.  The eggs cooked perfect and I enjoyed my meal.  Service was friendly and comfortable.

Magical experience. The food and wine were extraordinary, poetic combinations. The waitresses were a seamless part of the experience; elegant and obliging, they really made our dinner rich. Thanks for the great night!

Worth a trip on the D train from Bedford Park for the food and atmosphere.  I hope you stay forever.

Stumbled on this fabulous French find & I just had to write a great review. My husband & I shared a few plates bcs everything sounded so good, we couldn't decide what to have. The foie gras melts in your mouth, the kale salad was dressed with a wonderful yogurt-Ceasar dressing & the salmon was perfectly prepared atop a fresh vegetable salad featuring cucumbers, onions & tomatoes. Lastly, our server, Colin, took great care of us. We'll definitely be back.

What a cute place - had a great dinner there last night. The duck confit (breast) was great, the steak was also great, and overall it was a solid meal. My friend had The Two Bridges cocktail which was delicious. I didn't care for the Pinot noir by the glass but the Bordeaux was nice. I'd definitely return.

came here for lunch on a Wednesday. cute and intimate small French restaurant. Had affordable entrees and a pleasant ambiance in a quiet neighborhood!

Been coming here for years and amazingly this place has gotten even better and more fun. The music on Sunday nights is excellent and the DJ on the weekends after the dinner period is over is fantastic. Easily one of my favorite places In NYC.... WOW! This might be some of the best food in NYC. Super cute spot. Feels like it's actually in a hidden French neighborhood with genuine French food. The boeuf carrot might be one of best pieces of meat I've ever had. Great personable staff. This place is special.

We were in NYC visiting our son and asked him to pick a venue to have dinner Friday night. I could have not been more pleased with his selection. Les Enfants is an extremely cozy, little restaurant with incredible food! I emphasize that, as I am quite particular in what I like to eat. We had oysters, slow braised beef, duck and mussels plus a salad. The food was all totally superb, as well as the service, and we will definitely plan on returning there on our next trip to NYC. It truly is a hidden gem:) We recommend it highly!!!

Small and cozy atmosphere makes this lower Manhattan restaurant a "to-go-place", when everywhere else are fully booked on one of those weekend nights. What's unexpected was the food quality. We were a large group, so everyone ordered different food and we pretty much got to taste everything on our table. (The beauty of casual dining!) I would hate to see this place getting too popular and hard to get seated, but they definitely deserve to be highly rated. The wait staffs, happened to be a good friend of someone at our table, we're so amazing and pleasant. I would love to come back whenever I'm in the area.

The boeuf was truly special here as the meat was so tender that it seemed to fall apart as I chewed it.  Definitely would go back just for that dish.

A really nice, little French restaurant in LES. The ambiance is very mellow and low key, and I love the exposed brick and super French mural drawing on the walls. The dinner menu is not very expansive, but they have very good options for all of your favorite French staples. I got the duck confit and it was amazing. It was served with white beans, dark greens, a puree of some sort, and a delicious, slightly sweet sauce. I definitely want to come back to get the duck again (hopefully they will serve the duck breast that night,) as well as to try the camembert and mussels.

I love the laidback vibe and food on this place. I think it is very hard in this city to create a place which has a genuine non pretentious vibe. Usually it is artificial.  This place is not.  I think you can go for a special event or to just have a delicious meal. It will work for both

Loved the service and the food was really good. I ordered the avocado eggs Benedict with chorizo. Delicious. A plus was the mimosas. If they were endless this would have been paradise.

I LOVE this place! The food is always excellent and the menu changes regularly. Farm to table, fresh, organic. The cocktails are also delicious and seasonal. And on top of that it's a community. You'll always run into interesting people you might have already met there. Can't say enough good things about Les Enfants!

I ate here almost every Monday for an entire year. Never thought I'd work in Chinatown for 12 months and primarily eat French food. But that's what happened after I stumbled upon Les Enfants. A cute restaurant with friendly service and fantastic food. They also have a great lunch special for $11 - choose two items from their salads, soups and tartines (half soup/salad kind of thing). I never ordered something I regretted. The kale salad is outstanding, as is the goat cheese salad. I also loved the savory buckwheat crepes. Just come in, come often, and try everything on the menu!

We were looking for a brunch spot in the area and saw this place on yelp. Decided to give it a try. Couldn't be more pleased. The staff was super friendly and attentive (at one point they dropped my toast on the ground, they responded by bringing me 4 pieces of toast) and the food was delicious. We will be coming back for sure, I think this is our new brunch spot in the area.

Such a beautiful location tasty breakfast nice drinks and when we were here today (Sunday) a live guitarist was playing, no shredding solos just a lilting sparkle of music in the air. Pretty glass and woody interior, cute blackboard paint on parts of the exposed brick walls with specials and things written in colorful chalk. The kind of place you hope to come in to from a cold day. So happy they opened here!

Decor was lovely and the staff was kind. My boyfriend's cod was MUCH too salty. My muscles (the special) were ok. Unfortunately, the 5th member of our party's order was never placed by the waiter, so he received it much later than the rest of our table :(
Wonderful restaurant - soothing ambience, dark and cozy, and fantastic food.  This restaurant shows how it's done!

What a great spot for the LES. Cindy was outstanding in service. We loved the Sancerre and the Chardonney was yummy. We tried the special fillet mignon with Shrimp. Every taste was outstanding. We should have stayed for dessert but were too full. The room is intimate and inviting. We also tried the tartine and tartare du bled. Both tasty.  Cash only!

I'm still daydreaming about the duck hachis Parmentier I had here, which was a shepherd's pie of sorts. Paired with the kale Caesar salad and a nice glass of red, it was one of my favorite meals of the year. No crumb went spared, it was so deliciously seasoned and perfectly baked to bubbling perfection. Such a rare find! Equally as enjoyable was the vibe of the staff and clientele--so neighborly and energizing. Everyone seemed to be in a great mood, reveling in the moment and totally un-self-conscious. And the DJ (Friday) was awesome and totally feeling it. Zero stoicism in this place!! Also, the parklet the owners built outside is further testament to their local love in its inviting of public use. LES Enfants makes me feel both totally at home and like I'm in every favorite spot from my travels, all at once. Magic.
Best brunch I ever had in a long while. The service is great and the interior design brings the feel of the uniqueness around the neighborhood. Definitely a place to come for any occasion.

Great food, great ambiance, great staff ! I came for a late lunch on Thursday. Not crowdy at all, staff was incredibly friendly. The steak tar tar is no longer on the menu, but I asked and they delivered. Pretty good flavors all around. Would recommend for any occasion.

Came here on a late Thursday night, place was very busy but my friend and I managed to score a table. It's a small restaurant featuring a large bar area, very nice hip atmosphere and traditional french food. Even though she was swamped, our server managed to keep up and was very helpful. We both ordered the roasted chicken, which was very well cooked and came with sweet roasted carrots and creamy (almost a little too salty but decadent) mashed potatoes. Got the creme brûlée for desert, perfect caramelized top- creamy and set custard. So why four stars? The place is cash only- but a main dish here runs for at least $20 a pop, meaning that unless you carry a decent amount of cash around with you, you are probably going to have to use their atm which surprise surprise will charge you a fee. It's 2019, if a restaurant is charging more than $12 for a dish I'm going to be annoyed that it's cash only. Hopefully this will be something they will reconsider in the future.

Easily made same day reservations for 2 via phone for a Friday night.  Called again to let them know I was running late and they said it was no problem.  Surprisingly, the restaurant was not crowded when we arrived.  Intimate, cute, and relatively quiet atmosphere, outside seating if we wanted it (we did not).  A DJ was setting up while we ate but the music was always at a very reasonable volume.  Food was absolutely delicious!  My bf and I opted to share 2 apps and a main but everything we saw on other people's tables made our mouths water.  We ordered the tartare, foie gras and the duck.  The tartare refreshing and delicious, light, well seasoned, wonderful textured - simply fantastic.  The foie gras was an incredible smooth mixture of just the right amount of sweetness in the jelly to compliment the savory.  We finished with the duck.  My bf cut into it and you could hear the perfectly crisped skin crackle.  It was accompanied by lentils, buttery fingering potatoes and a small salad.  Very tasty.  Ordered the summer sangria and a milk stout to accompany.  The summer sangria could have been a tad sweeter, but then I tend to like my sangrias more sugary than most.  Super friendly staff.  They were very attentive.  Food came out in timely fashion.  Looking forward to trying more of the menu at Les Enfants!

If you don't want to get saddled with ATM fees, you have to carry around a good bit of cash on the streets of New York, and I don't know... it just didn't seem worth it to me.

We appreciated that the food came out quickly since our kids are young with short attention spans. We will be back for sure to try their lunch menu.

I have used Yelp for many years to look at reviews and decide on a restaurant, but never took the time to do a review. It pains me that it took a very negative experience to prompt me to write my first review as I truly enjoyed my first experience to this restaurant. I live one block from the restaurant and dined at Ye's Apothecary in January for my birthday. I had a wonderful time and planned to go back again. The small, intimate dining room was beautiful, the food was incredible (especially the Chili Filet O Fish), and the service good. For this reason, I made another reservation in April. I had some friends visiting had previously lived in Hong Kong and were looking for great Chinese food. I decided to take them to Ye's Apothecary for this reason. When we arrived, we passed the beautiful dining room you see on the website and shown to a table in the very back of the restaurant, meshed between two red curtains (with an elevator panel peeking out of one), and directly next to the wait station. There were no other tables in view, and it is a lonely, isolated place to dine, unless you want to hide your date or friends from the public, then it's perfect, see photo attached. I asked if we could be seated in the main dining room where there were at least 8 other empty tables. The woman said she would check and after a few moments returned and said "sorry we have other reservations and were booked". I reminded her that I too had a reservation, and I am standing right here. Why could we not be seated in one of the empty tables and another party arriving later be seated in the table we were shown. She then "checked" and returned to say that our only option was this table. I am perplexed at how they are prioritizing their customers that some get the nice tables and others get sent to isolation. I told her that I would rather cancel my reservation and go elsewhere than to dine at this terrible table. The woman simply kept apologizing through a condescending grin. So, we canceled the reservation and went elsewhere and had a wonderful evening. Because of this interaction, I will never dine there again, and it saddens me as it was my favorite local spot to take my friends and the food is very good, but this woman's inflexibility to accommodate a customer when it was obvious she could has taken Ye's Apothecary off my list for good. I write this review simply to be aware that if you are excited to dine in the beautiful dining room, you may be lucky, but diner beware that you may also be seated in a dark, small corner secluded from the ambience and decor that lured you in in the first place.

You do not need a reservation for the bar and if I were alone; I would say the bar is a perfect place. First the drinks were very good, I had one with a lollipop which I liked a lot. There was another one which I had and it was also really good but the lollipop drink was my favorite. Then we had the beef potstickers which were very good we got two orders. I really enjoyed dining at 3 Times which offers refined Chinese cuisine ranging from Shanghainese to Cantonese. My go-to dishes at 3 Times are the soup dumplings, pan-fried dumplings, beef pancake roll, beef noodle soup, and spicy wontons.  I enjoyed eating in pre-covid as the service was excellent however I usually just order frozen dumplings to go now and enjoy them in the comfort of my own home.
Came at 10:45pm tonight and it was closed for dine in said only online orders. Yelp says open till 11:30pm they should update it.

The 3rd time is the charm!!!  I was beyond pleased to have received my delivery promptly pleasantly, (and most importantly), with food cooked so to perfection, and presented in such a desirable manner with paper containers that hold the delectable flavors to such an optimal temperature that the food makes you want to both savor every bite, as well as pile it into your mouth in a mist unladylike way!!  Luckily, I didn't have to worry :). Go here, get a delivery  , or take out - do yourself a FAVOR!!

My gf and I had crab xiaolongbao and they taste weird. We knew something was off but we thought it's just the cooking skill. Not until we got home we started having stomachache and then we had the worst diarrhea ever. That crab was definitely bad. Foods are not fresh!
What a wonderful place.  The menu has so many delicious dishes.  The staff was so kind and helpful.  We loved all the dishes.  We will definitely be back.

Popped by on a Friday night with a friend when everything was booked in town and glad I did! They had a seat for us immediately and there was relatively short wait to receive our food - maybe 10 minutes or so. We got the Pan Fried Pork Buns which had a nice crispy bottom and were slightly juicy on the inside. I thought the Spicy Pork Wontons were very much on the mild side but flavorful enough. Our favorite dish was the Sautéed String Beans as it came with a slightly sweet dark soy sauce mix and very tender. The only disappointment was the dan dan noodles as they lacked flavor. Overall, I loved what they did with the space for a casual and chill dinner - very modern, clean, and spacious especially for New York. The decor is a mix of neutral tones and some modern Chinese photography on the wall. The bathroom is clean, always a plus.

I haven't had Nan Xiang in a while so I can't claim this is better 100%, but I believe this is at least on par if not better. The Xiao Long Bao soup is amazing and the pork is really good as well. The Beef Noodle Soup is quite good and the Beef Scallion is very standard. The Sheng Jian Bao though is amazing. Highly reccomended.

I love this place the first time I came, not too many people. Second time I came, was with 8 people and as soon we told them 8 people the manager/senior server was very annoyed, seated us with attitude and the entire time rushed us, put his hand up to my friends when they were talking. I've worked as a server and if it's a party over 7 then gratuity is included but like why be rude about it? We're giving you guys good business by ordering almost $300 worth of food and you're gonna treat us so horrible and rushed. Wanted to have a nice Chinese New Year dinner but couldn't even have that cause people like to be rude. Food was good, service wasn't

SORELY disappointed. I did come here based on the good reviews and feel rather.. lied to. The place is very spacious and EMPTY on a Friday night. The staff was rather unenthusiastic about seating me and placed me directly next to another party even though the place was empty. I had the shanghai fried noodles and the dan dan noodles and NEITHER were "authentic" or delicious. The staff also did not explain any current promotions. Honestly nothing special about the food here. Would not come back. Many other places with better food.
No comment

I'm rating 2 stars because the food was mediocre and moderately priced for the poor quality. The pictures of the food are more appealing than the actual dishes. Only note worthy dish were the soup dumplings. The service was beyond terrible. We had to ask for a can of Ginger ale, straws, napkins (all normal request items) several times. If you're near by definitely order DoorDash though -- the worker seemed to be super attentive to the in coming carry out orders. So much so that he argued with a DoorDash driver for 5 mins straight. (Tip your dashers! Their literally out here fighting for your food! Lol)  but seriously the food and service sucked!
No comment

Had a craving for soup dumplings in LES & stumbled across this place! Great service & food arrived piping hot. Soup dumplings were a touch on the salty side & confused to why food coloring was added to the shrimp & pork soup dumplings but the pan fried dumplings were delicious!

Friendly staff, easy to find seating and they regularly run specials like free soup dumplings with orders! The food is delicious and diverse. They also play interesting shows and images on the TVs in the restaurant, showcasing traditional food. Love coming here!

Waiter was super nice and kept refilling my water, changed from takeout to dine in due to personal schedule issues and they were extremely accommodating. Not to mention food was great, the braised beef was super tender

Really enjoyed this spot! Their food is a bit more on the pricier side compared to other Shanghai spots. But their food is absolutely amazing! It's not as greasy and very flavorful. My favorite is their Big Pork Bun. It was super juicy and delicious.
No comment

Don't waste your money or your time! We only took a few bites of food and had to stop because it was inedible. The shrimp fried rice was OFFENSIVELY bad. There was absolutely zero flavor...and not even sure there was soy sauce in there! We had to take matters into our own hands by recooking the fried rice!!!! The wrapping on all the dumpling options we chose was entirely too thick and as I'm writing this, I'm pretty sure I'll be sick tomorrow.

Great place to go with friends. It's BYOB which is always a plus!  Love the noodles here and the soup dumplings. Friendly service!
My friends and I were craving some Asian cuisine and came upon this gem! It was beautiful, clean, the food was delicious, and came quickly and the price was affordable. Will definitely be back.

Went here for a birthday dinner with friends last week before going out - their food is so delicious, the shrimp dumplings are great and everything has so much flavor. We ordered a feast of dumplings, scallion pancakes, beef with broccoli, kungpao chicken. Also the waiter was so nice,  and brought out taro puffs as a birthday surprise - so kind!! Thank you!

This is a great place to have a family-style meal with a group. Lots of good East Asian dishes for acceptable NYC prices. The soup dumplings were definitely my favorite! At the time we went, there was also a deal where if you spent more than $30 you got a free crispy duck entrée, so we appreciated that extra item.
No comment

Really good dumplings. Way better pancakes than Vanessa's. Service was attentive and able to accommodate allergies. The spicy house braised brisket wasn't overwhelmingly spicy it at all. Would definitely return.
No comment

PERFECT PLACE FOR EVERYTHING! Everything was so good. BYOB? And the liquor store is next door? Omg yes! Bae enjoyed the string beans but the noodles were the winner. AND, the service was ELITE! Shout out to Jason. Jason is a real one!
They were very patient while we decided what to order. Delicious Mapo tofu. Excellent Chinese broccoli. Very fresh.

column3: Downtown Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: I was looking for a good chinese place in NYC while visiting & came across 3 times. I was not disappointed! I loved their pork/shrimp soup dumplings, shanghai noodles, & eggplant dish! I will definitely come back if I ever visit New York again!
The food is really small. A crispy duck worth of 15 dollars has less than 10 pieces and they were rlly small like a bit small. While the sweat sour soup is like in a small small bowl

Stumbled across this place and noticed "Soup Dumplings & More" on the window. Very clean and spacious vibe. Truffle soup dumplings a bit pricey -- would recommend just sticking with pork soup dumplings since they're a bit stingy with the truffle flakes and the truffle taste is very faint. Decent amount of juicy soup in the pork dumplings though! Vegetable "soup" dumplings had no soup -- just dumplings stuffed with vegetables. Excellent service! Would come again for more tasty soup dumplings!

Take out portions were small and entrees were overpriced. Everything there was meh and for the cost I could have paid half the price and had double the portion in Chinatown.  I really wanted to support a nearly Chinese restaurant that looked clean and spacious but the quality and quantity of the food did not meet expectations.
Incredible soup dumplings! The truffle one is my favorite. The restaurant is very clean and modern. The service was quick and friendly. Highly recommended
This place is so great!!! Love the employees here and the red bean puffs are delicious!! Highly recommend this spot!!
No comment

No comment

Delcious food and fast service! The tripe and beef was amazing, pan fried pork buns, radish puffs (make sure to get it, they are so fresh and flakey!!!!!), and dan dan noodles! You can also order frozen dumplings to bring home. We've done that before and they were so easy to make!
Delicious takeout. The dan dan noodles were fresh and a touch spicy, and the soup dumplings were delectable. Will order again!

This place has solid soup dumplings, and it's open late (later than any other soup dumpling place seems to be -- seems like the Yelp hours are wrong as I ordered through door dash well after closing time.) I got almost every kind of soup dumpling, and I recommend the Truffle Soup Dumplings and Sesame Walnut Puffs for dessert. I definitely will come back when I'm having some late night cravings.
No comment

Small Chinese Restaurant with delightful food near Union Square. I had the soup dumplings, Chinese Broccoli and crispy duck. It was all very delicious! Will definitely go back. I'm all about the food.

Kinda sad. Wanted to eat here. They close at 11, and we came before 10... there were a lot of open chairs.. but they wouldn't let us sit. They could only do "take outs" cause the "kitchen's busy". It was a weird experience. The guy was nice but idk, it was just a weird thing.
No comment

Tried their soup dumplings and they were delicious! The skins were not too thick and were perfectly cooked. They were able to get a lot of broth inside the dumplings, and the broth was savory and delicious. There was also a good amount of meat inside each soup dumpling. Some of the best soup dumplings in Manhattan!

Phenomenal soup dumplings on the lower east side. We love it here! Will come back again for more dumplings.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Absolutely amazing! Very fast service and amazing food. We loved the soup dumplings and the dumplings in chili oil.
The service is fine but the food is not as good as what people says, their food taste like every other Shanghai restaurant in New York . Nothing special

So they updated the menu recently and they now offer a range of stir fries and authentic Shanghai homey dishes vs what was predominantly a dim sum menu. Don't worry the main dim sum options are still there but if you wan to branch out and have some good seafood and veggies with rice it would be a good time to visit. I highly recommend the new additions - salt and pepper fishing and the shrimp. Very fresh and flavorful.

We got the crab soup dumplings, pork soup dumplings, radish pancakes and Dan Dan noodles. During Covid, we couldn't eat inside so we got our food to go. Everything was packed well and got home without any spillage/ drama which was great. The soup dumplings were juicy, the wrapper around the meat was the right texture and they were yummy. I really liked the fried radish pancakes but my husband didn't love them as much since they're not really a pancake but more like a deep fried, mini flakey bun stuffed with shredded radish. I think they were expertly cooked - warm, not greasy, super flakey and golden. The Dan Dan noodles were tasty too. Great neighborhood place, would definitely go back.
Found this dumping spot around the area. The server was extremely nice and courteous. The truffle dumpling was to die for. If you're in the area you must stop by and give this spot a try. A must try
Our family was very happy with this restaurant.  They said Fusion on the restaurant but it tasted very authentic and delicious.
Great place with the most authentic Chinese food! (Yet so affordable as well) Love it that the dumplings are so cute!

One of the most authentic and delicious Chinese/Shanghai restaurants I've eaten at in a very long time. Get the Pork Soup Dumplings, Beef & Potato Stew, Tan Tan Noodles, Drunken Chicken, and Scallion Pancakes. Too late for pictures.
No comment

One of my favorite go to lunch spots. Also I think the food is prepared with cleanliness and seasoned well. Some dishes are a bit saltier than I like such as the sautéed beans but overall I think they do a wonderful job preparing the dishes and the price point is pretty good too if I don't want them to compromise on quality or cleanliness.
Took too long. I placed an order for pick up. They were more than 40 min late from the time predicted. And it was right when they opened on a Sunday. No excuse.
Awesome food!  I'd come back any time!  Perfect for couple dates, and a great family dinner.  My taste buds are glad!

The place is very clean and well maintained, staff are friendly. I ordered the dan dan noodles so I can only comment that the noodles has very bombastic flavors that you can't really forget. The peanut sauce has a unique blend of interesting herbs and spices in it which you could feel it's made with great quality.

Excellent new Chinese restaurant in the lower Eastside. Clean, attentive and friendly service and delicious food. Soup was complex and delicious, but should have been a little hotter. Scallion and beef pancake roll with hoisin sauce was very yummy. Xiao Long Bao was good, not great. My wife loves DanDan noodles and gave these a thumbs up. We will be back  ... perhaps, next weekend  ... with friends/family to share our discovery and so that we can try even more dishes. They deserve a 4+ star rating. Am rounding up because they deserve to succeed.

This is a new spot in the Lower East Side and on the way I get home. On Friday night, it was not too crowded when I ordered 1 Peanut Jana noodles (peanut, pork, egg, green onion) and 1 beef noodles (supposed to be beef, egg, green onion, pickles). Unfortunately, NO beef in my noodles :( Why I had to get a veggie noodle for $11.25 ? That was so sad and disappointed when I opened the container. I may still give them another chance to try other dishes (dumpling,rice) but come on, please focus on the order!
At the end of my meal, I had to take a DEEP breathe because I was so full! All the flavors were incredible!! The service was great too! If I was a local here in NY, I would for sure recommend!
No comment

I love love the buns here!  I buy them frozen and my family and I can't get enough. The owners are very kind and their customer service is awesome!!! Will go back every few weeks to fill up my freezer!!
Got the Dan Dan noodles, good flavor and good price, but you get a portion equal to what you pay for.

Never again!!!! Gave the place a try based on reviews. I walked in for lunch with the kids, in the midst of the waitress taking my order an elderly Asian couple walks in and the waitress walks away, seats them and takes their order. Then she comes back 5 minutes later asking if I was ready to order, I finish placing the kids order. When its time for checkout, the waitress is all in my face stating that I only payed for the food. As a promotion, they have a free soup dumpling give away for dine-in only and she charged for 2 orders when one was supposed be free then demanded a tip upon check-out. She even stood in front of me as a way to not let me leave the restaurant without tipping her, worst service doesn't equal a tip.
Awesome food!  Definitely coming back!  The food is really awesome and I love the stony steamed pork buns!
The food is here is super delicious! We ordered take out and everything was hot and super tasty. Excellent soup dumplings, fried rice, green beans and porky bits. YUMMM!

It's a little out of the way but the food in general was good! Ofc get the cod roe and pork dumplings, and the truffle dumplings. The fish with green peppercorn that was recommended by reviewers was also delicious. I would def get that again if I go back. The cauliflower and broccoli dish was good too but $16 is a bit much. Get the free edamame when you check in! The service was rlly good. This visit was 5 stars but I give it 4 stars overall. Hope they keep it up!
Unbelievable food! Went to the LES location and exceeded expectations. Incredible, a  must if you want real dim sum!

Amazing food at an affordable price with fast service. This place is byob, which is great for saving $ when you want to drink. They also ran a promotion so I got some free soup dumplings. Very convenient for takeout or dine in.

After seeing their ad on Instagram, i ordered frozen wontons and siu mais. They are actually really good. I put the wontons in homemade chicken soup. Siu mais are good to have them for quick steam and snack. I love the rice and pork one. Love that it is not salty so you can add soy sauce! They let me keep the southern vege buns which was mistakenly delivered. I am not a fan of buns because of how little filling they usually have, but this one had pretty full filling inside. I wouldn't mind trying their pork buns in the future. Also a plus that they deliver to Jersey City!!!!! JC food sucks this makes me very happy. Their staff/owner are very kind and caring. I really appreciate their customer service.

Food was neutral. I was looking forward to the pork soup dumplings and was a bit disappointed. They were kind of bland not much flavor to the soup. I also ordered their fruit tea but was never delivered. The broccoli and beef lunch special was really good and flavorful so all around 6/10
Cancelled my Uber eats order 45 minutes after accepting it. The driver was waiting upside. Been waiting 45 mins and all other restaurants are closed now. F this place.

This place is so cute with really good, authentic dim sum. My Chinese side of the family would absolutely love this place. The servers there are also really sweet. I literally order this 4 times a week. Love them!
Pork soup dumplings are sooo good! Just had a little problem with the dumplings getting stuck and have paper on my dumpling. I'm still going back!

A group of 6 ate here last nights and we thought the food was good. Two hours after dinner - two of our friends got extremely sick and continued to throw up for the next 12 hours. 2 out of 6 people got food poisoning at this restaurant - we got dumplings and they think the meat in some of the dumplings were bad.

When I went there it was right after they opened. I was with a friend and we had dinner here. It's a very underrated place. I've never had such amazing soup dumplings until I came here. Love this place :)
Best xiaolong bao in the city. Gives Flushing restaurants a run for their money. Service was fast and effective
Food is amazing, portion sizes are good, the inside is very clean and well lit, great for lunch or dinner, also great for families.

I have seen videos and reviews of this place, so when my wife and I were visiting the big apple, we made sure to check out this place with the authentic chef from Shanghai! And boy it did not disappoint! One of the Best pork soup dumplings, crab roe flavored soup dumplings and Truffle soup dumplings! The xiao long bao were so authentic with the thinnest rappers imaginable....having been to multiple places in NYC and LA, this place by far does them best! The steamed egg with shrimps was to die for! But what really blew us away was the pork Bao! Doughy from the outside and juicy Flavorful from the inside! With a bunch of waiters that were extremely attentive to you on a Sunday Brunch time, and reasonable prices, what more could you wish for! We are definitely coming back!

Soup dumplings tasted fresh but could use a bit more soup. The scallion pancake with beef was phenomenal; definitely to die for. Service was great; the staff was attentive, kind, and welcoming. Would definitely come again.
No comment
You know a restaurant is sketchy when the description says "Lower East Side" in google maps. The food looks delicious just from the photos.

The LES location just soft opened a few days ago, and I decided to give it a try. Having tried the other 3 Times restaurant at 818 Broadway, the one here is kind of different in terms of the menu. Apparently they offer a dinner option here, which includes many delicious Chinese food. That's was a surprise to me because the food at the other location is already pretty good and they offer a lot more here! My friend and I ordered HK style sautéed crispy pork feet, 3 Times special braised snow beef, Chinese broccoli. I would say the food weren't too greasy at all. Actually they were cooked right on the point! I highly recommend the snow beef. It was so tasty! Would definitely come back.
Fantastic soup dumplings! This will definitely be a new late night fav since it's right by Delancey. Very modern vibe and good service.
No comment
No comment

Wanted dumplings so badly!  Ordered some frozen fried dumplings for pick up.  A little expensive, but dumplings were very good.  Good for a quick lunch.  Only thing I would add is maybe instructions on how to cook them for those that don't know.  Maybe add on website.   I would definitely order them again.

Went back to 3 times and had a pleasant experience. The servers were attentive and kind, food was great. The moon cakes and noodles with minced pork sauce were the highlight of the dinner. I was a bit disappointed they no longer serve their entree items so the menu is now the same as the location near union square, but food was still great.

Went there during lantern festival for the Ningpo Tangyuan, a glutinous rice ball with sweet stuffings. A little disappointed to see that the LES restaurant didn't have a lot of the entrees on their social media page. I I ordered the crispy croaker rolls instead, its basically fish wrapped in fried bean curd skin. It has a very crispy shell, the fish inside is steamed tender, it almost melts in the tongue. The only thing I dislike is so much oil is used to fry the roll, there was so much oil I could see it dripping. They give a sauce to soak up the oil; which I find in dismay is something like thousand islands sauce, quite thick and tangy, which doesn't help lessen the oily taste of the fried bean curd skin at all. Me recommendation would be to serve it with a sour or spicy sauce in the future?...the Tangyuan were fine, nothing special, I don't think it was handmade, but just be bought from supermarkets instead, but still a decent meal

Amazing place. The house noodles were so delicious and cheap! The shi bing tongs are perfect and huge! Very generous portions. Dreaming of both right now. So happy this place exists and look forward to coming back soon!
